H0.text: Flowing water carves through rock to form a canyon.

H1.text: Lava from an underwater volcano cools to form a mountain, describing an interaction between the hydrosphere and the atmosphere.

H2.text: Ashes rise from a volcanic eruption to block sunlight is the statement that describes an interaction between the hydrosphere and the atmosphere.

H3.text: Water vapor rises from the ocean to form clouds, describing an interaction between the hydrosphere and the atmosphere.

A4.text: The ocean is the source of 86% of global evaporation.

A5.text: 78% of global precipitation occurs over the oceans.
